newsitem.title: GERMANY: BASF says sees 1997 sales of 50 bln dmk.
newsitem.headline: BASF says sees 1997 sales of 50 bln dmk.

text.p: German chemicals group BASF AG said on Wednesday it expects to post sales of 50 billion marks in 1997.
"We have set ourselves the goal of reaching sales of 50 billion marks," BASF management board chairman Juergen Strube said in a speech at a news conference.
In the group's annual report released earlier this morning, BASF had said it planned to reach sales of 49 billion marks.
Additionally, BASF said it also planned to let its shareholders participate in strong results. "We renew our promise to our shareholders that they will take pleasure in BASF shares," Strube said.
Strube added that profits would also rise, sticking by a statement also made in the annual report.
"We are optimistic that especially for BASF, 1997 will again be a special year," he said.
